emuInput.TitMainTitle: Centre Avenue with Wash-A-Teria, and Chas. W. Lutz Choice Meats at 2145 Centre Avenue, at intersection of Elmore Street, with Crawford Grill no. 2 on Wylie Avenue, in background, Hill District
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 20, 1957, pg. 28 reads: "Tight Squeeze - With motorists parking on both sides of this narrow cow path, which bears the name of Elmore St., off Centre Ave., towards Wylie Ave., drivers of autos and trucks really need 20-20 vision and the latest bomb sight maneuver between the parked vehicles. One extra coat of paint o n the moving car or truck and sideswiping is guaranteed.  At night it's an obstacle course of which the Army would be proud.-Harris Photos."  Lutz' Meat Market was started by Charles Lutz, taken over by his son, Carl Lutz, then purchased by Calvin Cunningham.
